articles.title: India Stops Export Of 27,000 Vivo Phones Worth $15 Million: Report - NDTV
articles.description: Indian authorities have prevented Vivo from exporting some 27,000 smartphones for more than a week in a setback to the Chinese company's plan to ship devices from India to neighboring markets.
articles.content:
Vivo exported its first batch of India-made smartphones in early November. (File)

articles.description: Adobe is not the only tech company tightening its grip. Some Indian tech firms such as Byju's, Josh, and HealthifyMe have also laid off hundreds of employees in the last few weeks.
